instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Can SMC's be used on different models from same year?
threads.message: The stack of boards got too high so I'm finally ending my boycott of SMC replacements and I'm trying to figure out if an SMC from an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> can be used for an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> or vice-versa. Or an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> for an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. I'm assuming the RAM amount doesn't matter, but I'm guessing the SMC for DG would be different than the IG?

threads.title: Can SMC's be used on different models from same year?
threads.message:
3662/3787 NO for sure.
3476 SMC tested good on 3536; probably viceversa valid too...
